titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2606) making appropriations for foreign operations, export financing, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2000, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-269, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2606 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be read by paragraph. Bill is open to amendments. Rule provides that before consideration of any other amendment, it shall be in order to consider the amendments printed in part A of H.Rept 106-268. Provides that the amendment printed in Part B of H.Rept. 106-268 may be offered only in the appropriate point in the reading of the bill. All points of order are waived against the amendments printed in the report.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 96.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 263.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 256 - 172 (Roll no. 348).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/27/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.R. 2606 (foreign operations, export financing, and related programs appropriations).
